briefTitle: Annual Study to Investigate Inactivated Subunit Influenza Vaccine Due to New Virus Strains for the Southern Hemisphere 2015 Season
officialTitle: Immunogenicity, Reactogenicity and Safety of the Trivalent Influenza Subunit Vaccine Influvac® for the Southern Hemisphere Season 2015. An Open-Label, Baseline-Controlled Study in Two Age Groups: Adult Subjects ≥ 18 and ≤ 60 Years and Elderly Subjects ≥ 61 Years of Age
summary: Influenza (flu) viruses change continuously, therefore also the parts of viruses used in influenza vaccines can vary from year to year. The current study is a phase III A clinical trial with a commercially available vaccine (Influvac®) supplied in pre filled syringes. The objective of this study is to investigate the immunogenicity and safety and tolerability of the changed influenza vaccine virus composition in two groups of subjects in good health: subjects aged \>= 18 and \<= 60 years and subjects \>= 61 years of age (elderly).

primaryOutcome.measure: the Serum Antihemagglutinin Antibody Titers and the Derived Parameters Defined in the Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use (CHMP) Note for Guidance on Harmonization of Requirements for Influenza Vaccines for Influenza Vaccines.
